body: $TNT IMO
created_at: anyone claiming that they can "time" the market is either new to investing or has his/her own agenda.

body: It is impossible to time the macro market
created_at: as it can be detached from reality. It is even more impossible to time individual stocks which are driven by unpredictable events/sentiments.

body: I had a few successful swing trades in the past and made pretty good returns. And eventually it turns out that I can make much more by simply holding. The fundamental problem with swing trading is the mindset. If you sell easily when it is tough
created_at: you will also simply settle with a small gain and miss out the bigger gains.

body: For stocks like TNT with strong fundamentals and strong investor base
created_at: I have no fear holding it long term. In the short term
column3: I can also see +20% +30% days incoming to pull us back into the normal range as 1) shorts need to cover 2) people waiting on the sideline 3) existing investors are not willing to give up their future retirement hope for a few pennies.

body: $TNT Wow did you notice that bid moments before closingâ€¦helpful to look wide at the broader market and how they get you buying stocks (general comment) only to dump the next day(s). Time your re-entry carefully.
$TNT https://techcrunch.com/2021/07/16/with-open-banking-on-the-horizon-the-fintech-sme-love-story-is-just-beginning/
By far the biggest beneficiary of open banking
column3: will be SMEs. This is not necessarily because open-banking frameworks offer specific new functionality that will be useful to small and medium-sized businesses. Instead
column4: it is a reflection of the fact that SMEs have historically been so poorly served by traditional banks.

body: SMEs are underserved in a number of ways. Traditional banks have an extremely limited ability to view the aggregate financial position of an SME that holds capital across multiple institutions and in multiple instruments
created_at: which makes securing finance very difficult.
